events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred last night involving another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on the details describing the collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle this auto accident claim for further processing and investigation.
The customer was informed that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is now under review.
Customer was requested to submit all necessary documents including photos of the vehicle damage and police report.
Customer submitted the requested documents, including clear photos of the damaged car and the official collision report.
Investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident and liability began based on the submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded, confirming the other driver was at fault for the vehicle collision without customer negligence.
A settlement offer covering the full repair costs for the damaged vehicle was proposed to the customer.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely handling of the claim.
The auto accident claim was formally approved by the insurance company following customer acceptance.
The insurance payment covering vehicle repairs was issued promptly to the customer's bank account.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment processing and final confirmation with the customer.
All documents and records related to the vehicle collision claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
